scheme_name: Subsidy for Fund Raising from SME Exchange
description: The Subsidy for Fund Raising from SME Exchange in Tamil Nadu supports MSMEs by subsidizing costs incurred while raising funds through the SME Exchange. The scheme aims to facilitate access to public capital markets for growth and expansion.
key_features: Subsidy on expenses for raising funds via SME Exchange

benefits.subsidy: 25% of expenses for fund raising, up to a maximum of Rs. 5 Lakhs
benefits.one_time_assistance: Subsidy provided one time per MSME

business_criteria: Must be a registered MSME as per the MSME Development Act, 2006
Must be located in Tamil Nadu
operational_criteria: Must have raised funds through an IPO or FPO on a recognized SME Exchange
Expenses must be related to fund raising (e.g., legal, audit, listing fees)

eligible_activities: Expenses for raising capital through SME Exchange, including legal, audit, and listing fees

steps: Visit the Tamil Nadu MSME portal or Industries Department website
Submit an online application with details of funds raised and expenses
Upload required documents, including MSME registration and expense receipts
Applications are reviewed by the District Industries Centre (DIC)
Approved applicants receive the subsidy upon verification
application_process.note: Applications must be submitted within one year of fund raising

required_documents.document: Proof of Funds Raised (SME Exchange Documents)

special_notes: The subsidy is limited to 25% of eligible expenses or Rs. 5 Lakhs, whichever is lower
MSMEs must comply with Tamil Naduâ€™s industrial regulations
Only expenses directly related to fund raising are eligible
